subtitles.title: So glad that semester is over!

content.text: This semester was good but was stressful at the same time. I was really fortunate to take CMPT360 Intro to Operating Systems this semester which was a fantastic class. Learning about virtualization and process communication was probably the coolest part for me. I managed to pass all my classes fairly well, even though the non comp sci ones were very boring.

I was really fortunate to work with Dr.Cobzas, a professor at Macewan University who had approached me looking for help with her Intro to Graphics class. I really enjoyed that class last year, that being said I felt like I was not ready to help teach it in the labs for her! I decided to brush up on it quickly and was fortunate to get a hang of WebGL again quite quickly. I helped make the lab assignments for the class and then attended the lab to help answer any questions where I could kind of thing. WebGL was super fun to get back into and Dana was a huge help with learning even more than I did when I took the class as a student. I've never really pictured myself being a game developer or anything like that but if I could program graphics for work I'd gladly do so! It's a unique experience not being able to debug much because of the shader code not having any ways of logging values. I also plan on doing a graphics related capstone project next semester with Dr.Cobzas and am super excited about it. I'll do my best to upload some WebGL stuff on this site for showing a bit of how it works!
